pageContext.claim: “But, in the meantime, [the farmers] were targeted by China. I went to Sonny Perdue, and I said, "Sonny, how much has China spent, let's say, in the -- in just about the biggest year?" He said, "Sixteen billion dollars, sir." I said, "Here's what I'm doing. I'm giving our farmers $16 billion out of the tariffs, which frankly, are much more than that." I shouldn't say that, because they'll ask for more.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a made-up number. China imported $9.1 billion of U.S. farm produce in 2018 -- mainly soybeans, dairy, sorghum and pork -- down from $19.5 billion in 2017, according to the American Farm Bureau.
